page.title: 09A FARMER'S YEAR (1)
page.content: Many of the farmers use the moor in a similar way.Mrs Bagnall told us the pattern of her farming year. JANUARY:Most of the time is spent feeding the cattle with hay or straw. They have to stay in the Barn because it is very cold and they don't like being outside. FEBRUARY:Once again much of the time is spent feeding the cattle.The farmers have to keep the machinery in working order because it wouldn't be very good if the machinery didn't work when it was needed. MARCH:The cornfields are fertilized so that they will give better crops.The crop is sprayed with pesticides to kill the bugs.Spring corn is planted ready to be harvested in July or August. APRIL:Potatoes are planted ready for harvest in late September.The lambs are born.The grass is fertilized.
